pyzui.mediaobject module¶

Media to be displayed in the ZUI (abstract base class).

class pyzui.mediaobject.MediaObject(media_id, scene)[source]¶

Bases: PhysicalObject

MediaObject objects are used to represent media that can be rendered in the ZUI.

Constructor: MediaObject(string, Scene)

Create a new MediaObject from the media identified by media_id, and the parent Scene referenced by scene.

render(painter, mode)[source]¶

Render the media using the given painter and rendering mode.

render(QPainter, int) -> None

Precondition: mode is equal to one of the constants defined in RenderMode

move(dx, dy)[source]¶

Move the image relative to the scene, where (dx,`dy`) is given as an on-screen distance.

move(float, float) -> None

zoom(amount)[source]¶

Zoom by the given amount with the centre maintaining its position on the screen.

zoom(float) -> None

hides(other)[source]¶

Returns True iff other is completely hidden behind self on the screen.

hides(MediaObject) -> bool

fit(bbox)[source]¶

Move and resize the image such that it the greatest size possible whilst fitting inside and centred in the onscreen bounding box bbox (x1,y1,x2,y2).

fit(tuple<float,float,float,float>) -> None

property media_id¶

The object’s media_id.

property scale¶

The factor by which each dimension of the image should be scaled when rendering it to the screen.

property topleft¶

The on-screen positon of the top-left corner of the image.

property onscreen_size¶

The on-screen size of the image.

property bottomright¶

The on-screen positon of the bottom-right corner of the image.

property onscreen_area¶

The number of pixels the image occupies on the screen.

property pos¶

The position of the object.

property centre¶

The on-screen coordinates of the centre of the pobject (the point that will maintain its position on the screen as the pobject is being zoomed).

exception pyzui.mediaobject.LoadError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Exception for if there is an error loading the media.

class pyzui.mediaobject.RenderMode[source]¶

Bases: object

Namespace for constants used to indicate the render mode.

Invisible = 0¶
Draft = 1¶
HighQuality = 2¶
